$eref.description: The set of properties specific to the Azure ML web service resource.

___storageAccount.description: The storage account associated with the service. This is used to store both datasets and diagnostic traces. This information is required at creation time (PUT) and only the key is updateable after that. The account credentials are hidden on a GET web service call.

___parameters.description: The set of global parameters values defined for the web service, given as a global parameter name to default value map. If no default value is specified, the parameter is considered to be required.

___exposeSampleData.description: Flag that controls whether to expose sample data or not in the web service's swagger definition.

___title.description: The title of the Azure ML web service.

___keys.description: The set of access keys for the web service. If not specified at creation time (PUT), they will be generated automatically by the resource provider.

___machineLearningWorkspace.description: This is only populated at creation time (PUT) for web services originating from an AzureML Studio experiment.

___readOnly.description: If true, the web service can no longer be updated / patched, only removed. Otherwise, the service resource supports changes.

___description.description: The description of the Azure ML web service.

___output.description: Swagger schema for the service's output(s), as applicable.

___diagnostics.description: Settings controlling the diagnostics traces collection for the web service.

___realtimeConfiguration.description: Configuration for the service's realtime endpoint.

___exampleRequest.description: Sample request data for each of the service's inputs, as applicable.

___assets.description: Set of assets associated with the web service.

___commitmentPlan.description: The commitment plan associated with this web service. This is required to be specified at creation time (PUT) and is not updateable afterwards.

___package.description: The definition of the graph package making up this web service.

___input.description: Swagger schema for the service's input(s), as applicable.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

_88RealtimeConfiguration.description: Holds the available configuration options for an Azure ML web service endpoint.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___maxConcurrentCalls.description: Maximum number of concurrent calls allowed on the realtime endpoint.

_88GraphPackage.description: Defines the graph of modules making up the machine learning solution.

$eref.description: Defines a global parameter in the graph.

___links.description: Association links for this parameter to nodes in the graph.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___graphParameters.description: The collection of global parameters for the graph, given as a global parameter name to GraphParameter map. Each parameter here has a 1:1 match with the global parameters values map declared at the WebServiceProperties level.

$eref.description: Specifies a node in the web service graph. The node can either be an input, output or asset node, so only one of the corresponding id properties is populated at any given time.

___outputId.description: The id of the output element represented by this node.

___parameters.description: If applicable, parameters of the node. Global graph parameters map into these, with values set at runtime.

___inputId.description: The id of the input element represented by this node.

___assetId.description: The id of the asset represented by this node.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___nodes.description: The set of nodes making up the graph, provided as a nodeId to GraphNode map

$eref.description: Defines an edge within the web service's graph.

___targetPortId.description: The identifier of the destination node's port that the edge connects into.

___sourcePortId.description: The identifier of the source node's port that the edge connects from.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___edges.description: The list of edges making up the graph.

_88ColumnSpecification.description: Swagger 2.0 schema for a column within the data table representing a web service input or output. See Swagger specification: http://swagger.io/specification/

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___format.description: Additional format information for the data type.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___x-ms-isordered.description: Flag indicating whether the categories are treated as an ordered set or not, if this is a categorical column.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___enum.description: If the data type is categorical, this provides the list of accepted categories.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___x-ms-isnullable.description: Flag indicating if the type supports null values or not.

_88StorageAccount.description: Access information for a storage account.

_88TableSpecification.description: The swagger 2.0 schema describing a single service input or output. See Swagger specification: http://swagger.io/specification/

___type.description: The type of the entity described in swagger.

$eref.description: Swagger 2.0 schema for a column within the data table representing a web service input or output. See Swagger specification: http://swagger.io/specification/

___format.description: Additional format information for the data type.

___x-ms-isordered.description: Flag indicating whether the categories are treated as an ordered set or not, if this is a categorical column.

___enum.description: If the data type is categorical, this provides the list of accepted categories.

___x-ms-isnullable.description: Flag indicating if the type supports null values or not.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___properties.description: The set of columns within the data table.

_88GraphParameter.description: Defines a global parameter in the graph.

$eref.description: Association link for a graph global parameter to a node in the graph.

___parameterKey.description: The identifier of the node parameter that the global parameter maps to.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___links.description: Association links for this parameter to nodes in the graph.

_88WebServiceKeys.description: Access keys for the web service calls.

_88ServiceInputOutputSpecification.description: The swagger 2.0 schema describing the service's inputs or outputs. See Swagger specification: http://swagger.io/specification/

___type.description: The type of the entity described in swagger. Always 'object'.

$eref.description: The swagger 2.0 schema describing a single service input or output. See Swagger specification: http://swagger.io/specification/

___type.description: The type of the entity described in swagger.

___properties.description: The set of columns within the data table.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___properties.description: Map of name to swagger schema for each input or output of the web service.

_88GraphNode.description: Specifies a node in the web service graph. The node can either be an input, output or asset node, so only one of the corresponding id properties is populated at any given time.

___outputId.description: The id of the output element represented by this node.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___parameters.description: If applicable, parameters of the node. Global graph parameters map into these, with values set at runtime.

___inputId.description: The id of the input element represented by this node.

___assetId.description: The id of the asset represented by this node.

___interfaceString.description: The interface string name for the nested parameter.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

_88GraphParameterLink.description: Association link for a graph global parameter to a node in the graph.

___parameterKey.description: The identifier of the node parameter that the global parameter maps to.

_88AssetItem.description: Information about an asset associated with the web service.

Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___outputPorts.description: Information about the asset's output ports.

$eref.description: Parameter definition for a module asset.

___modeValuesInfo.description: Definitions for nested interface parameters if this is a complex module parameter.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___parameters.description: If the asset is a custom module, this holds the module's parameters.

$eref.description: Describes the access location for a web service asset.

___uri.description: The URI where the asset is accessible from, (e.g. aml://abc for system assets or https://xyz for user asets

___credentials.description: Access credentials for the asset, if applicable (e.g. asset specified by storage account connection string + blob URI)

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___inputs.description: Sample input data for the web service's input(s) given as an input name to sample input values matrix map.

___targetPortId.description: The identifier of the destination node's port that the edge connects into.

$eref.description: Diagnostics settings for an Azure ML web service.

___level.description: Level of tracing to be used: None - disables tracing; Error - collects only error (stderr) traces; All - collects all traces (stdout and stderr).

___expiry.description: Moment of time after which diagnostics are no longer collected. If null, diagnostic collection is not time limited.

___level.description: Level of tracing to be used: None - disables tracing; Error - collects only error (stderr) traces; All - collects all traces (stdout and stderr).
